intro: Chorizanthe howellii, commonly known as Howell's goatweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and bristly foliage. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and open plains. It has a low, spreading growth habit and produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Its botanical features make it well adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions.
